title: 2 Easy Ways to React to Messages on Instagram

steps.title: Open the message
steps.content: Open the message you want to react to on Instagram. The app icon looks like a camera lens on a purple to orange gradient background. [1] X Research source Tap the messages icon (it looks like the Facebook Messenger icon). If you see the older default paper airplane icon instead, you will not be able to react to messages with emojis. To fix this, try updating your Instagram Messenger. Go to your profile, tap the three-line menu icon, then tap Settings > Update Messenging > Update . If that doesn't work, make sure you have a Facebook Messenger account signed in on your phone or tablet .

steps.title: Double-tap the message to quick-react.
steps.content: Double-tap the message to quick-react. The default emoji for quick-reacting is a heart, but you can change that.

steps.title: Long-tap on the message to see the emojis you can react with.
steps.content: Long-tap on the message to see the emojis you can react with. You can use an emoji from the suggestions, or you can tap the + to see all the emojis you can use.

steps.title: Tap an emoji to react to the message.
steps.content: Tap an emoji to react to the message. It will appear below the message you tapped. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Open the message you want to react to on Instagram.
steps.content: Open the message you want to react to on Instagram. The app icon looks like a camera lens on a purple to orange gradient background. Although you can use the website to react to messages, you can only change the default icons from the mobile app. Tap the messages icon (it looks like the Facebook Messenger icon). Tap the conversation to see individual messages.

steps.title: Long-tap on the message to see the emojis you can react with.
steps.content: Long-tap on the message to see the emojis you can react with. You'll see a pop-up menu of the default reactions you can use.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . This plus sign is at the far right end of the menu and will slide another menu up from the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Customize.
steps.content: Tap Customize . It's on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Tap an emoji that you want to replace.
steps.content: Tap an emoji that you want to replace. Tap a reaction to replace it with one of the emojis in the menu below. For example, tap the heart icon to change the default quick-reaction.

steps.title: Tap the emoji you want to use instead.
steps.content: Tap the emoji you want to use instead. Using the scrollable menu at the bottom of your screen, pick an emoji that you want to react with instead of the default. For example, you can replace the default heart with a green heart. You'll see a confirmation message in the text above the emoji menu.

steps.title: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ and sign in.
steps.content: Go to https://www.instagram.com/ and sign in. You can use any web browser to react to messages on Instagram; you cannot, however, change the default reactions/emojis using a web browser.

steps.title: Navigate to a message
steps.content: Navigate to a message that you want to react to. To do this, click the Messenger icon (it looks like the Facebook Messenger icon) in the top right of the page, then tap the conversation to see the individual messages.

steps.title: Double-click a message to quick-react.
steps.content: Double-click a message to quick-react. This will react with the default heart icon since you're using a computer.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over the message you want to react to.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over the message you want to react to. When you hover the mouse over the message, you'll see a smiley face appear. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Click an emoji to use it.
steps.content: Click an emoji to use it. You'll see a list of popular reactions appear or you can scroll through the menu to see more emojis. [4] X Research source Once you click an emoji, it will be added to the bottom of that message as your reaction.
